intro: Cyclosorus × nudatus, commonly known as the naked cyclosorus, is a hybrid aquatic plant belonging to the family Marsileaceae. It is characterized by its small, floating leaves that are typically unbranched and lack the typical leaflets found in other species of the genus. The plant thrives in still or slow-moving freshwater environments, often found in ponds and marshes. Its reproductive structures are simple, with small, inconspicuous flowers that are usually submerged. Cyclosorus × nudatus plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various microorganisms and invertebrates.
